monster.name: Animated Broom
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone

trait.name: False Object
trait.text: If the broom is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the broom move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check to discern that the broom is animate.

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The broom doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The broom makes two melee attacks

action.name: Broomstick
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Animated Chained Library
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone

trait.name: False Object
trait.text: If the library is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the library move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check to discern that the library is animate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The library makes two attacks

action.name: Chained Book
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 12).

monster.name: Arrant Quill

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Quill makes two attacks with his dagger and uses Supreme Mockery.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Quill's Fable (Recharge 6)
action.text: Quill utters a short fable while targeting up to five creatures within 30 feet of him that he can see. Each target that can hear Quill's magical fable must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Quill casts one of the following spells using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (save DC 17) :
• At will: light, mage hand, prestidigitation • 3/Day each: detect magic, dispel magic.faerie fire, hold monster • 1/Day each: mind blank, teleport

action.name: Supreme Mockery
action.text: Quill hurls a string of insults laced with enchantments at a creature he can see within 60 feet of him. If the creature can hear Quill (though it need not understand him), it must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or take 66 (12d10) psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

monster.spells: light, mage hand, prestidigitation, detect magic, dispel magic.faerie fire, hold monster, mind blank, teleport

monster.name: Bak Mei
monster.save: Str +5, Dex +9, Con +9, Int +6, Wis +8, Cha +8
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened, paralyzed

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
trait.text: If Bak Mei fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Bak Mei carries a staff of striking with 10 charges.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
trait.text: While Bak Mei is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, his AC includes his Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Thunder Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to h it, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) thunder damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be deafened and stunned until the start of Bak Mei's next turn.

action.name: Staff of Striking
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands, and Bak Mei can expend up to 3 of the staff's charges. For each expended charge, the target takes an extra 1d6 force damage.

action.name: Heal Self (Recharges after a Long Rest)
action.text: Bak Mei regains 2d8 + 4 hit points, and all levels of exhaustion end on him.

action.name: Nimble Escape (Bonus Action)
action.text: Bak Mei takes the Disengage or Hide action.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
reaction.text: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, Bak Mei deflects the missile. The damage he takes from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + 12. If the damage is reduced to 0, Bak Mei catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and Bak Mei has a hand free.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Bak Mei can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Bak Mei regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary.name: Crane Dance
legendary.text: Bak Mei moves up to 20 feet. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Thunder Strike (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Bak Mei uses Thunder Strike.

monster.name: Canopic Golem
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Limited Spell Immunity
trait.text: The golem automatically succeeds on saving throws against spells of 7th level or lower, and the attack rolls of such spells always miss it.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The golem makes two attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (4d10 + 5) force damage.

action.name: Crystal Dart
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) force damage.

reaction.name: Spell Deflection
reaction.text: In response to a spell attack missing the golem, it causes that spell to hit another creature within 120 feet of it that it can see.

monster.name: Cloud Giant Ghost
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
trait.text: The ghost can see 120 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The ghost regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the ghost takes radiant damage or damage from a magic weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of the ghost's next turn. The ghost dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The ghost makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Spectral Weapon
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) force damage.

action.name: Etherealness
action.text: The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The ghost casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability and requiring no material components:
• At will: fog cloud • 3/Day: telekinesis • 1/Day: control weather

action.name: Wind Howl (Recharge 6)
action.text: The ghost emits a dreadful howl that summons a cold, biting wind. This wind engulfs up to three creatures of the ghost's choice that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target is pulled up to 20 feet toward the ghost and must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Constructed Commoner
monster.conditionImmune: exhaustion, poisoned

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The commoner doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep, and it gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest. When it drops to 0 hit points, it becomes a lifeless object.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Corrupted Avatar of Lurue
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, paralyzed, poisoned

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The avatar makes two attacks: one with its hooves and one with its horn.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (8d6 + 4) necrotic damage.

action.name: Horn
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (8d6 + 4) necrotic damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be transformed into a wolf under the avatar's control. This transformation lasts for 1 hour, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. The target's game statistics are replaced by the wolf's statistics, but it retains its hit points. The target is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its wolf form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech. The target's gear melds into the new form, and it can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon tortoise makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. It can make one tail attack in place of its two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (3d12 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (3d12 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 20 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the dragon tortoise and knocked prone.

action.name: Steam Breath (Recharge 5—6)
action.text: The dragon tortoise exhales abrasive sand in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 52 (15d6) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Faerl has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Faerl makes two attacks.

action.name: Rapier
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8+1) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: Faerl adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, he must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.name: Fungal Servant
monster.languages: The languages it knew in life
monster.immune: necrotic, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The fungal servant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
trait.text: A destroyed fungal servant gains a new body in 24 hours if its heart is intact, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the fungal servant's heart.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The fungal servant is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The fungal servant has the following cleric spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): sacred flame, thaumaturgy • 1st level (4 slots): command, guiding bolt, shield of faith • 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, silence, spiritual weapon • 3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, dispel magic • 4th level (3 slots): divination, guardian of faith • 5th level (2 slots): contagion, insect plague • 6th level (1 slot): harm

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The fungal servant can use its Dreadful Glare and makes one attack with its rotting fist.

action.name: Rotting Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to spores. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.

action.name: Dreadful Glare
action.text: The fungal servant targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the fungal servant, it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened until the end of the fungal servant's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all fungal servants for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The fungal servant can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The fungal servant regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: The fungal servant makes one attack with its rotting fist or uses its Dreadful Glare.

legendary.name: Blinding Spores
legendary.text: Blinding spores swirls magically around the fungal servant. Each creature within 5 feet of the fungal servant must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the creature's next turn.

legendary.name: Blasphemous Word (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The fungal servant utters a blasphemous word. Each non-undead creature within 10 feet of the fungal servant that can hear the magical utterance must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of the fungal servant's next turn.

legendary.name: Channel Negative Energy (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The fungal servant magically unleashes negative energy. Creatures within 60 feet of the fungal servant, including ones behind barriers and around corners, can't regain hit points until the end of the fungal servant's next turn.

legendary.name: Whirlwind of Spores (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text:
The fungal servant magically transforms into a whirlwind of spores, moves up to 60 feet, and reverts to its normal form. While in whirlwind form, the fungal servant is immune to all damage, and it can't be grappled, petrified, knocked prone, restrained, or stunned.
Equipment worn or carried by the fungal servant remain in its possession.

monster.spells: sacred flame, thaumaturgy, command, guiding bolt, shield of faith, hold person, silence, spiritual weapon, animate dead, dispel magic, divination, guardian of faith, contagion, insect plague, harm

monster.name: Gingwatzim
monster.speed: walk 30 ft., fly 30 ft. (hover) in its true form only
monster.conditionImmune: poisoned

trait.name: Alternate Forms
trait.text: The gingwatzim has two alternate forms, both of which are chosen by its creator when the gingwatzim comes into being. One form is an exact duplicate of a Tiny nonmagical object (such as a book, dagger, or gemstone) that its creator is carrying or wearing when the gingwatzim is conjured. The other form can be any Tiny beast. Once these alternate forms are chosen, they can't be changed.

action.name: Energy Drain (True Form Only)
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 16 (4d6 + 2) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or gain 1 level of exhaustion.
When the target finishes a short or long rest, the target loses every level of exhaustion gained from this attack.

action.name: Change Shape
action.text: The gingwatzim changes from its true form—a 3-foot-diameter sphere of luminous ectoplasm—into one of its two alternate forms, or from one of those forms back into its true form. In object form, it can't move or make attacks but otherwise retains its statistics, and it is indistinguishable from the thing it is imitating. In beast form, it retains its hit points but otherwise uses the stat block of the beast it is imitating. When it dies, the gingwatzim reverts to its true form and then vanishes.

monster.name: Grippli Warrior
monster.speed: walk 30 ft., climb 30 ft., swim 30 ft.
monster.languages: Grippli plus one other language (usually Common, Draconic, or Primordial)

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The grippli can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The grippli can leap 30 feet horizontally or 20 feet vertically from a standing position.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The grippli makes one attack with its tongue. If this attack hits, the grippli can make a melee attack using its trident against the same target.

action.name: Tongue
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: The target is grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the grippli can't grab another creature.

action.name: Trident
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 2 (1d4) piercing damage if the grippli had advantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, plus 2 (1d4) piercing damage if the grippli had advantage on the attack roll.

monster.name: Hag of the Fetid Gaze

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The hag can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• At will: dancing lights, minor illusion, vicious mockery

trait.name: Mimicry
trait.text: The hag can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Shared Spellcasting
trait.text:
While all three members of the Fetid Gaze are within 30 feet of one another, they can each cast the following spells from the wizard's spell list but must share the spell slots among themselves:
• 1st level (4 slots): charm person, witch bolt • 2nd level (3 slots): alter self, suggestion • 3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, glyph of warding, slow • 4th level (3 slots): blight, polymorph • 5th level (2 slots): dominate person, seeming • 6th level (1 slot): Otto's irresistible dance
For casting these spells, each hag is a 12th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as her spellcasting ability. The spell save DC is 12 + the hag's Intelligence modifier, and the spell attack bonus is 4 + the hag's Intelligence modifier.

trait.name: Hag Eye (Coven Only)
trait.text:
A hag coven can craft a magic item called a hag eye, which is made from a real eye coated in varnish and often fitted to a pendant or other wearable item. The hag eye is usually entrusted to a minion for safekeeping and transport. A hag in the coven can take an action to see what the hag eye sees if the hag eye is on the same plane of existence. A hag eye has AC 10, 1 hit point, and darkvision with a radius of 60 feet. If it is destroyed, each coven member takes 3d10 psychic damage and is blinded for 24 hours.
A hag coven can have only one hag eye at a time, and creating a new one requires all three members of the coven to perform a ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour, and the hags can't perform it while blinded. During the ritual, if the hags take any action other than performing the ritual, they must start over.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Illusory Appearance.
action.text:
The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.
The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching her would feel her rough flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 20 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

action.name: Invisible Passage
action.text: The hag magically turns invisible until she attacks or casts a spell, or until her concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While invisible, she leaves no physical evidence of her passage, so she can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment she wears or carries is invisible with her.

monster.spells: dancing lights, minor illusion, vicious mockery, charm person, witch bolt, alter self, suggestion, dispel magic, glyph of warding, slow, blight, polymorph, dominate person, seeming, Otto's irresistible dance

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
trait.text: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The monk makes two attacks.

action.name: Force Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) force damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Dart
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.name: Jade Tigress
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
trait.text: While Jade Tigress is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, her AC includes her Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Force Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) force damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the start of Jade Tigress's next turn.

action.name: Poisoned Dart
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 7 (3d4) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain 1 level of exhaustion.

action.name: Heal Self (Recharges after a Long Rest)
action.text: Jade Tigress regains 2d8 + 4 hit points, and all levels of exhaustion end on her.

action.name: Nimble Escape (Bonus Action)
action.text: Jade Tigress takes the Disengage or Hide action.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
reaction.text: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, Jade Tigress deflects the missile. The damage she takes from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + 9. If the damage is reduced to 0, Jade Tigress catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and Jade Tigress has a hand free.

monster.name: K'Tulah

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
K'Tulah is a 4th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). K'Tulah has the following druid spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produce flame, shillelagh • 1st level (4 slots): entangle, longstrider, speak with animals, thunderwave • 2nd level (3 slots): animal messenger, barkskin

trait.name: Feline Agility
trait.text: When K'Tulah moves on her turn in combat, she can double her speed until the end of the turn. Once she uses this ability, K'Tulah can't use it again until she moves 0 feet on one of her turns.

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit (+4 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 6 (1d8+2) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh or if wielded with two hands.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) slashing damage.

monster.spells: druidcraft, produce flame, shillelagh, entangle, longstrider, speak with animals, thunderwave, animal messenger, barkskin

monster.name: Kiddywidget
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, deafened, exhaustion, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The kiddywidget doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The kiddywidget makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled by the kiddywidget (escape DC 8).

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) lightning damage.

monster.name: Lichen Lich
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
trait.text: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed lich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The lich makes four attacks.

action.name: Poisonous Touch
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 17 (5d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute.
The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Wither
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The lich casts one of the following spells using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (save DC 19):
• At will: druidcraft • 3/Day each: detect magic, fog cloud, pass without trace • 1/Day each: antilife shell, dispel magic, speak with plants, transport via plants

action.name: Fire Storm (7th-Level Spell; 1/Day)
action.text: The lich fills up to ten 10-foot cubes with fire. Every cube must be within 150 feet of the lich and occupy a space the lich can see, and each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube. Each creature in the area must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 38 (7d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried. If the lich chooses, plant life in the area is unaffected by the spell.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The lichen lich can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The lichen lich regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: The lich makes an attack.

legendary.name: Poison Prick (Cost 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The lich targets one poisoned creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious until the poisoned condition ends on it.

legendary.name: Sap Life (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The lich targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or take 11 (2d10) necrotic damage. The lich regains a number of hit points equal to the amount of damage that the creature takes.

monster.spells: druidcraft, detect magic, fog cloud, pass without trace, antilife shell, dispel magic, speak with plants, transport via plants

monster.name: Lightning Golem
monster.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak
monster.immune: lightning, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Berserk
trait.text:
Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.
The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
trait.text: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) lightning damage.

monster.name: Master Sage
monster.skill: Arcana +11, History +11, Insight +7, Investigation +11, Medicine +10, Nature +11, Religion +11

action.name: Shocking Grasp (Cantrip)
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +8 to hit (with advantage if the target is wearing armor made of metal), reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (3d8) lightning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The sage casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks):
• At will: light, mage hand, mending, prestidigitation • 3/Day each: comprehend languages, detect magic, dispel magic, identify, levitate, locate object, Tenser's Floating Disk, unseen servant • 1/Day each: banishment, contact other plane, Drawmij's instant summons, legend lore, locate creature, planar binding, polymorph, protection from evil and good, scrying, sending, true seeing

action.name: Fireball (3rd-Level Spell; 3/Day)
action.text: The sage creates a fiery explosion centered on a point it can see within 150 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners and ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

reaction.name: Shield (1st-Level Spell; 3/Day)
reaction.text: When the sage is hit by an attack or targeted by a magic missile spell, it calls forth an invisible barrier of magical force that protects it. Until the start of its next turn, the sage has a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and it takes no damage from magic missile.

monster.spells: light, mage hand, mending, prestidigitation, comprehend languages, detect magic, dispel magic, identify, levitate, locate object, Tenser's Floating Disk, unseen servant, banishment, contact other plane, Drawmij's instant summons, legend lore, locate creature, planar binding, polymorph, protection from evil and good, scrying, sending, true seeing

monster.name: Miirym
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, poisoned, prone, restrained

trait.name: Bound to Candlekeep
trait.text: Miirym can't leave Candlekeep and is immune to any effect that would place her in a location outside it, including an extradimensional space. If she dies, Miirym regains her form and all her hit points after 1d10 days, reappearing in the location where she died or in the nearest unoccupied space.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: Miirym regains 40 hit points at the start of her turn. If Miirym takes damage from a magic weapon or a spell, this trait doesn't function at the start of Miirym's next turn. Miirym dies only if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: Miirym can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. She takes 5 (1d10) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Miirym fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: X-Ray Vision
trait.text: Miirym can see through solid matter out to a range of 60 feet. To her, opaque creatures, objects, and obstacles within that distance appear transparent and don't prevent light from passing through them. This vision can penetrate 5 feet of stone, 3 inches of common metal, and up to 10 feet of wood or dirt. Thicker substances block this vision, as does a thin sheet of lead.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 34 (9d6 + 3) force damage.

action.name: Breath Weapons (Recharge 5-6)
action.text:
Miirym uses one of the following breath weapons.
Cold Breath. Miirym exhales an icy blast in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 21 Constitution saving throw, taking 67 (15d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Necrotic Breath. Miirym exhales a bolt of necrotic energy in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 82 (15d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Paralyzing Breath. Miirym exhales paralyzing gas in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Frightful Presence
action.text: Each creature of Miirym's choice that is within 120 feet of her and aware of her must succeed on a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Miirym's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Miirym casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (save DC 21) and requiring no material components:
• At will: dancing lights, mage hand • 3/Day each: detect magic, detect thoughts, dispel magic, locate creature l/day each: dispel evil and good, wall of force

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Miirym can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Miirym regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Bite
legendary.text: Miirym makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Miirym magically teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

monster.spells: dancing lights, mage hand, detect magic, detect thoughts, dispel magic, locate creature, dispel evil and good, wall of force

monster.name: Mimic Chair
monster.conditionImmune: prone

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Grappler
trait.text: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
trait.text: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape DC 10). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
trait.text: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

action.name: Pseudopod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

monster.name: Nintra Siotta
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, stunned

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Nintra fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Nintra makes two attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d4 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Shard of Shadow
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d6 + 7) necrotic damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Nintra casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (save DC 20) and requiring no material components:
• 3/Day each: dispel magic, faerie fire, mirror image

action.name: Storm of Shattered Glass (Recharge 6)
action.text: Nintra targets a point she can see within 60 feet of her and creates a 20-foot-radius sphere of swirling glass shards centered on that point. Each creature in the sphere must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If Nintra is in the sphere, the shards deal no damage to her.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Nintra can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Nintra regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: Nintra makes one attack.

legendary.name: Fey Step
legendary.text: Nintra teleports to an unoccupied space she can see within 30 feet of her.

legendary.name: Shadow Strikes (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Provided she is in bright or dim light, Nintra causes her shadow to attack a creature within 10 feet of her. Her shadow makes two claw attacks, each attack identical to Nintra's claw attack except that it deals psychic damage instead of piercing damage.

monster.spells: dispel magic, faerie fire, mirror image

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The behir makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: Constrict
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 16) if the behir isn't already constricting a creature, and the target is restrained until this grapple ends.

action.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5—6)
action.text: The behir exhales a line of lightning that is 20 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 (12d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Swallow
action.text:
The behir makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the behir, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the behir's turns. A behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time.
Any creature swallowed by a parasite-infested behir must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the behir's turns or be feasted upon by blood parasites, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save. This damage is in addition to the damage caused by the behir's digestive acids.
If the behir takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behir must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the behir. If the behir dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monster.name: Sage
monster.skill: Arcana +8, History +8, Insight +4, Investigation +8, Medicine +6, Nature +8, Religion +8

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The sage casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks):
• At will: light, mage hand, mending • 3/Day each: comprehend languages, detect magic, identify • 1/Day each: dispel magic, levitate, locate object, see invisibility, sending, tongues, unseen servant

action.name: Shocking Grasp (Cantrip)
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit (with advantage if the target is wearing armor made of metal), reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d8) lightning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

reaction.name: Shield (1st-Level Spell; 3/Day)
reaction.text: When the sage is hit by an attack or targeted by a magic missile spell, it calls forth an invisible barrier of magical force that protects it. Until the start of its next turn, the sage has a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and it takes no damage from magic missile.

monster.spells: light, mage hand, mending, comprehend languages, detect magic, identify, dispel magic, levitate, locate object, see invisibility, sending, tongues, unseen servant

monster.name: Sapphire Sentinel
monster.immune: poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Slow (Recharge 5—6)
action.text: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Sapphire
action.text: The sapphire has 3 charges. As an action, the golem can expend 1 charge to cast dispel magic (as a 9th-level spell) from the sapphire using Constitution as its spellcasting ability. The sapphire ceases to glow if all its charges are expended, but it regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn and glows again once it has 1 or more charges.

monster.name: Shemshime
monster.resist: acid, bludgeoning, fire, lightning, piercing, slashing, thunder
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

trait.name: Crushing End
trait.text: If damage reduces Shemshime to 0 hit points, Shemshime instead drops to 1 hit point unless the damage is the result of Shemshime being crushed by an object weighing at least 1,000 pounds.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: Shemshime can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Maddening Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) psychic damage.

action.name: Whispers of Violence
action.text: Shemshime chooses up to two creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw, or that target takes 7 (1d8 + 3) psychic damage and must use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack against one creature it can reach (Shemshime's choice) that Shemshime can see.

action.name: Howling Babble (Recharge 6)
action.text: Shemshime targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The creature must make a DC 1 3 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 21 (4d8 + 3) psychic damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

monster.name: Skitterwidget
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, deafened, exhaustion, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
trait.text: Whenever the skitterwidget is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The skitterwidget doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The skitterwidget makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled by the skitterwidget (escape DC 13).

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) lightning damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

reaction.name: Good Parent
reaction.text: The skitterwidget imposes disadvantage on one attack roll made against a kiddywidget it can see within 5 feet of it.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
trait.text: While Steel Crane is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, his AC includes his Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Force Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) force damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the start of Steel Crane's next turn.

action.name: Whip
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage or, if the target is a creature, Steel Crane can grapple the target instead (escape DC 15) . Steel Crane can't make attacks with the whip while using it to grapple a creature. Anytime on his turn, he can release a creature grappled by the whip (no action required).

action.name: Heal Self (Recharges after a Long Rest)
action.text: Steel Crane regains 2d8 + 4 hit points, and all levels of exhaustion end on him.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
reaction.text: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, Steel Crane deflects the missile. The damage he takes from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + 10. If the damage is reduced to 0, Steel Crane catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and Steel Crane has a hand free.

reaction.name: Slow Descent (3/Day)
reaction.text: When Steel Crane falls, he can slow his descent, taking no damage from the fall.

monster.name: Storm Giant Skeleton
monster.conditionImmune: exhaustion, poisoned

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant makes two attacks with its greatsword or hurls two rocks.

action.name: Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (6d6 + 9) slashing damage plus 18 (4d8) necrotic damage.

action.name: Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 35 (4d12 + 9) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Lightning Strike (Recharge 5—6)
action.text: The giant hurls a magical lightning bolt at a point it can see within 500 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Swarm of Animated Books
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned

trait.name: False Objects
trait.text: If the swarm is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the swarm move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check to discern that the swarm is animate.

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a 1-foot-tall, 8-inch-wide, 2-inch-thick object. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Book Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage if the swarm has half its hit points or fewer.

monster.name: Valin Sarnaster
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life
monster.immune: necrotic, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Valin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
trait.text: While her heart remains in Alessia's body, Valin re-forms inside her sarcophagus, regaining all her hit points and becoming active again.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Valin is a 10th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). Valin has the following cleric spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): sacred flame, thaumaturgy • 1st level (4 slots): command, guiding bolt, shield of faith • 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, silence, spiritual weapon • 3rd level (3 slots): clairvoyance, dispel magic • 4th level (3 slots): divination, dimension door • 5th level (2 slots): contagion, scrying • 6th level (1 slot): harm

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Valin can use her Dreadful Glare and makes one attack with her rotting fist.

action.name: Rotting Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6+4) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.

action.name: Dreadful Glare
action.text: Valin targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of her. If the target can see Valin, it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies and mummy lords for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Valin can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. Valin regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: Valin makes one attack with her rotting fist or uses her Dreadful Glare.

legendary.name: Blinding Dust
legendary.text: Blinding dust and sand swirls magically around Valin. Each creature within 5 feet of Valin must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the creature's next turn.

legendary.name: Blasphemous Word (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Valin utters a blasphemous word. Each non-undead creature within 10 feet of her that can hear the magical utterance must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of her next turn.

legendary.name: Channel Negative Energy (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Valin magically unleashes negative energy. Creatures within 60 feet of Valin, including ones behind barriers and around corners, can't regain hit points until the end of her next turn.

legendary.name: Whirlwind of Sand (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text:
Valin magically transforms into a whirlwind of sand, moves up to 60 feet, and reverts to her normal form. While in whirlwind form, she is immune to all damage, and she can't be grappled, petrified, knocked prone, restrained, or stunned.
Equipment worn or carried by Valin remain in her possession.

monster.spells: sacred flame, thaumaturgy, command, guiding bolt, shield of faith, hold person, silence, spiritual weapon, clairvoyance, dispel magic, divination, dimension door, contagion, scrying, harm

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Varnyr has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put her to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Varnyr makes two attacks.

action.name: Cane
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: Varnyr adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, he must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.name: Wood Elf Wizard

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The wood elf has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the wood elf to sleep.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The wood elf's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• At will: dancing lights • 1/Day each: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
The wood elf is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The wood elf has the following wizard spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, poison spray, ray of frost • 1st level (4 slots): mage armor, magic missile, shield, witch bolt • 2nd level (3 slots): alter self, misty step, web • 3rd level (3 slots): fly, lightning bolt • 4th level (3 slots): Evard's black tentacles, greater invisibility • 5th level (2 slots): cloudkill

action.name: Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

action.name: Summon Demon (1/Day)
action.text: The wood elf magically summons a quasit, or attempts to summon a shadow demon with a 50 percent chance of success. The summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

monster.spells: dancing lights darkness, faerie fire, levitate, mage hand, minor illusion, poison spray, ray of frost, mage armor, magic missile, shield, witch bolt, alter self, misty step, web, fly, lightning bolt, Evard's black tentacles, greater invisibility, cloudkill

monster.name: Zikran
monster.languages: Aquan, Common, Primordial, Sahuagin, and Undercommon
monster.resist: acid, damage from spells; non magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing (from stoneskin)

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: Zikran can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Zikran has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Zikran is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). Zikran can cast disguise self and invisibility at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation, shocking grasp • 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, identify, mage armor*, magic missile • 2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, mirror image, misty step • 3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fly, lightning bolt • 4th level (3 slots): banishment, fire shield, stoneskin* • 5th level (3 slots): cone of cold, conjure elemental, scrying, wall of force • 6th level (1 slot): globe of invulnerability • 7th level (1 slot): teleport • 8th level (1 slot): mind blank* • 9th level (1 slot): time stop
* Zikran casts these spells on itself before combat.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage.

monster.spells: fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation, shocking grasp, detect magic, identify, mage armor, magic missile, detect thoughts, mirror image, misty step, counterspell, fly, lightning bolt, banishment, fire shield, stoneskin, cone of cold, conjure elemental, scrying, wall of force, globe of invulnerability, teleport, mind blank, time stop
